data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In order to move backward, you must be in a start position. In order to move forward, you will first be facing forward, then you are facing forward again, and regressing backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn your back to the starting point. Turn your right around, turn around. If you turn right you turn the opposite way around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 5 steps back to the starting point and return 10 steps back. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should take 1 step first if you want to return to starting point. It takes 7 steps to make you complete the sequence. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions state that one should take 10 steps to turn around, takes 9 steps to take 3 steps, and turn around, takes 5 steps. Taking 3 steps gives 3 steps. Taking 3 steps gets 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turn around, turn right 7 steps, then turn around, turn around, turn right 7 steps. The beginning is the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

You can’ t return to your starting point without first taking a directional change. So, the answer is no.

Take 1 step left and you will move forward with your toes facing the right. Take 1 step right and you will move to left with your toes forward. Take 1 step right and you will move to the left with your toes forward. So, the answer is No.

The directions require 9 steps to turn around, and then 7 steps to back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

The instructions point backward so it is possible to take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If one always leads with one's face forward, you can always face forward and never take 6 steps backward. Taking 6 step backwards results in getting 1 step backward and going back 6 steps, not back 4 steps. If one always leads with one's face forward and never takes 2 steps left, you can always take 2 steps left. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Doing the same thing twice changes directions and may frustrate you. The first instruction says: You always take 3 steps left. In doing this, you are taking 3 steps left and 1, you are taking 1, you are taking 3, and the final instruction states: You always take 5 steps left. Doing so gives you 10 steps left and 9, taking one step back. All of these choices could return you to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

For each of these steps, you always take the same path, and they would each get you one step closer to ending up back at the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you are standing down, you must always face forward. If you are standing right, you must always face forward. If you are standing to the side to take a step forward, you must take a step forward. If you are standing up to take a step backward, you must take a step backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you start facing forward, you can always take 6 steps backwards. If you start facing away and take 6 steps to the right, you are facing to the right because you have taken 6 steps to the right. If you start facing the right and take 7 steps left, you are facing left because you took 7 steps left. If you start facing to the left and take 4 steps backwards, you are facing left because you have taken 4 steps backwards. If you start facing to the left and take 7 steps left, you are facing left because you have taken 2 feet to the right. If you start facing to the right and take 4 steps backward, you are facing the right because you took 4 steps backwards. If you start facing the right and take 3 steps left, you are facing the left because you took 2 feet to the right. Thus, the answer is Yes.
